de.mrapp.android.adapter.list.itemstate

Interface ItemStateListAdapter<DataType>

  • Type Parameters:
    DataType - The type of the adapter's underlying data
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ListAdapter<DataType>, MultipleChoiceListAdapter<DataType>, NoChoiceListAdapter<DataType>, SelectableListAdapter<DataType>, SingleChoiceListAdapter<DataType>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractEnableStateListAdapter, AbstractFilterableListAdapter, AbstractItemStateListAdapter, AbstractListAdapter, AbstractSelectableListAdapter, AbstractSortableListAdapter, MultipleChoiceListAdapterImplementation, NoChoiceListAdapterImplementation, SingleChoiceListAdapterImplementation

    public interface ItemStateListAdapter<DataType>
    Defines the interface, an adapter, whose underlying data is managed as a list of arbitrary items, which may have different states, must implement. Such an adapter's purpose is to provide the underlying data for visualization using a AbsListView widget.
    Since:
    0.1.0

    • Method Detail

      • getNumberOfItemStates

        int getNumberOfItemStates()
        Returns the number of states, the adapter's items may have.
        Returns:
        The number of states, the adapter's items may have, as an Integer value. The value must be at least 1

      • setNumberOfItemStates

        void setNumberOfItemStates(int numberOfItemStates)
        Sets the number of states, the adapter's items may have. If the number of states is set to a value, less than the previous value, the states of the items, which became obsolete, will be set to the maximum state.
        Parameters:
        numberOfItemStates - The number of states, which should be set, as an Integer value. The value must be at least 1, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown

      • minItemState

        int minItemState()
        Returns the minimum state, the adapter's items may have.
        Returns:
        The minimum state, the adapter's items may have, as an Integer value

      • maxItemState

        int maxItemState()
        Returns the maximum state, the adapter's items may have.
        Returns:
        The maximum state, the adapter's items may have, as an Integer value

      • getItemState

        int getItemState(int index)
        Returns the current state of the item, which belongs to a specific index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the item, whose state should be returned, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        The state of the item, which belongs to the given index, as a Integer value

      • getItemState

        int getItemState(@NonNull
                 DataType item)
        Returns the current state of a specific item.
        Parameters:
        item - The item, whose state should be returned, as an instance of the generic type DataType. The item may not be null. If the item does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        Returns:
        The state of the given item as an Integer value

      • setItemState

        int setItemState(int index,
                 int state)
        Sets the state of the item, which belongs to a specific index, to a specific state, if it is currently enabled.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the item, whose state should be set, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        state - The state, which should be set, as an Integer value. The state must be between 0 and the value of the method getNumberOfStates():int - 1, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown
        Returns:
        The previous state of the item, which belongs to the given index, as an Integer value or -1, if the state has not been changed

      • setItemState

        int setItemState(@NonNull
                 DataType item,
                 int state)
        Sets the state of a specific item to a specific state, if it is currently enabled.
        Parameters:
        item - The item, whose state should be set, as an instance of the generic type DataType. The item may not be null. If the item does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        state - The state, which should be set, as an Integer value. The state must be between 0 and the value of the method getNumberOfStates():int - 1, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown
        Returns:
        The previous state of the given item as an Integer value or -1, if the state has not been changed

      • setAllItemStates

        boolean setAllItemStates(int state)
        Sets the states of all items to a specific state, if they are currently enabled.
        Parameters:
        state - The state, which should be set, as an Integer value. The state must be between 0 and the value of the method getNumberOfStates():int - 1, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown
        Returns:
        True, if the states of all items have been changed, false otherwise

      • triggerItemState

        int triggerItemState(int index)
        Triggers the state of the item, which belongs to a specific index, if it is currently enabled. This causes the state to be increased by one. If the state is already the maximum state, the state will be set to 0 instead.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the item, whose state should be triggered, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        The previous state of the item, which belongs to the given index, as an Integer value or -1, if the state has not been changed

      • triggerItemState

        int triggerItemState(@NonNull
                     DataType item)
        Triggers the state of a specific item, if it is currently enabled. This causes the state to be increased by one. If the state is already the maximum state, the state will be set to 0 instead.
        Parameters:
        item - The item, whose state should be triggered, as an instance of the generic type DataType. The item may not be null. If the item does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        Returns:
        The previous state of the given item, as an Integer value or -1, if the state has not been changed

      • triggerAllItemStates

        boolean triggerAllItemStates()
        Triggers the states of all items. if they are currently enabled. This causes the states to be increased by one. If a state is already the maximum state, the state will be set to 0 instead.
        Returns:
        True, if the states of all items have been changed, false otherwise

      • getFirstIndexWithSpecificState

        int getFirstIndexWithSpecificState(int state)
        Returns the index of the first item, which currently has a specific state.
        Parameters:
        state - The state of the item, whose index should be returned, as an Integer value
        Returns:
        The index of the first item, which currently has the given state, as an Integer value or -1, if the adapter does not contain an item with the given state

      • getFirstItemWithSpecificState

        DataType getFirstItemWithSpecificState(int state)
        Returns the first item, which currently has a specific state.
        Parameters:
        state - The state of the item, which should be returned, as an Integer value
        Returns:
        The first item, which currently has the given state, as an instance of the generic type DataType or null, if the adapter does not contain an item with the given state

      • getLastIndexWithSpecificState

        int getLastIndexWithSpecificState(int state)
        Returns the index of the last item, which currently has a specific state.
        Parameters:
        state - The state of the item, whose index should be returned, as an Integer value
        Returns:
        The index of the last item, which currently has the given state, as an Integer value or -1, if the adapter does not contain an item with the given state

      • getLastItemWithSpecificState

        DataType getLastItemWithSpecificState(int state)
        Returns the last item, which currently has a specific state.
        Parameters:
        state - The state of the item, which should be returned, as an Integer value
        Returns:
        The last item, which currently has the given state, as an instance of the generic type DataType or null, if the adapter does not contain an item with the given state

      • getIndicesWithSpecificState

        java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getIndicesWithSpecificState(int state)
        Returns a list, which contains the indices of all items, which currently have a specific state.
        Parameters:
        state - The state of the items, whose indices should be returned, as an Integer value
        Returns:
        A list, which contains the indices of all items, which currently have a specific state, as an instance of the type List or an empty list, if the adapter does not contain any items with the given state

      • getItemsWithSpecificState

        java.util.List<DataType> getItemsWithSpecificState(int state)
        Returns a list, which contains all items, which currently have a specific state.
        Parameters:
        state - The state of the items, which should be returned, as an Integer value
        Returns:
        A list, which contains the items, which currently have the given state, as an instance of the type List or an empty list, if the adapter contains no items with the given state

      • getItemStateCount

        int getItemStateCount(int state)
        Returns the number of items, which currently have a specific state.
        Parameters:
        state - The state of the items, which should be counted, as an Integer value
        Returns:
        The number of items, which currently have the given state, as an Integer value

      • isItemStateTriggeredOnClick

        boolean isItemStateTriggeredOnClick()
        Returns, whether the state of an item is triggered, when it is clicked by the user, or not.
        Returns:
        True, if the state of an item is triggered, when it is clicked by the user, false otherwise

      • triggerItemStateOnClick

        void triggerItemStateOnClick(boolean triggerItemStateOnClick)
        Sets, whether the state of an item should be triggered, when it is clicked by the user, or not.
        Parameters:
        triggerItemStateOnClick - True, if the state of an item should be triggered, when it is clicked by the user, false otherwise

      • addItemStateListener

        void addItemStateListener(@NonNull
                          ListItemStateListener<DataType> listener)
        Adds a new listener, which should be notified, when the state of an item has been changed.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be added, as an instance of the class ListItemStateListener. The listener may not be null

      • removeItemStateListener

        void removeItemStateListener(@NonNull
                             ListItemStateListener<DataType> listener)
        Removes a specific listener, which should not be notified, when the state of an item has been changed, anymore.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be removed, as an instance of the class ListItemStateListener. The listener may not be null
